DataElement.preferredName: Person Surgical Procedure Injury Eligibility Determination Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded yes/no/not applicable indicator whether a patient has had a major surgical procedure, open biopsy, or traumatic injury in order to determine if a person is suitable for enrollment in a study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Surgical Procedure Injury Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study by having had a diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue or damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.

Property.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.:Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgical procedure, open biopsy, or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to starting cediranib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient had any major sur
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had any major surgical procedure, open biopsy, or significant traumatic injury less than 3 weeks or minor surgical procedures (e.g., core biopsy or fine needle aspiration) within 1 week from first dose of first study drug administration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient less than 4 weeks post-op after major surgery and/or has failed to recover adequately from the toxicity and/or complications of major surgery prior to starting therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgical procedure, open biopsy or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to starting cediranib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had any major surgical procedures less than or equal to 28 days before beginning study treatment or minor surgical procedures less than or equal to 7 days before beginning study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had surgery less than 3 weeks prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery within 21 days prior to starting protocol treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery within 30 days prior or during study period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery within 21 days of starting protocol treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery or trauma within 28 days prior to entering study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgical procedure (as defined by the Investigator) within 28 days prior to the first dose of IP?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a major surgical procedure, open biopsy, or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to cycle 1 day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a major surgical procedure, open biopsy, or significant traumatic injury within 3 months prior to cycle 1 day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have major surgery within 2 weeks of starting therapy and did not recover from any effects of major surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has had prior major surgery, has patient failed to recover adequately from the toxicity and/or complications from the intervention prior to starting therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgical procedure, open biopsy, or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to starting cediranib or anticipation of need for major surgical procedures during the course of the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient at least 7 days beyond stereotactic biopsy and/or at least 14 days beyond open craniotomy at the time of registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled to the atezolizumab + bevacizumab combination arm, did patient have major surgery within 6 weeks of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in non-thoracic, non-BRD4 exploratory cohort was major surgery other than diagnostic surgery, dental surgery or stenting more than 3 weeks prior to the first dose of ZEN003694?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has undergone prior definitive surgery alone for an early stage (T1-2N0) HNSCC, has it recurred with Stage III-IVB disease at least 3 months after the initial surgery?

DataElement.changeDescription: 3/21/17 tt, versioned due to change in def.  07-02-14_Theradex_ghd.
